title: Danydee
author: Danydee
content: This is for (South) Korean people.. on the TV I saw them all using digital keypads for accessing their homes ! @LoyceV  https://www.zdnet.com/article/this-thermal-attack-can-read-your-password-from-the-heat-your-fingertips-leave-behind/ https://usa.kaspersky.com/blog/thermal-imaging-attacks/27380/  'thermal attack' can read your password from the heat your fingertips leave behind

comments.author: pingu39
comments.body: Hi, Why only for (South) Korean people? If this is true it will spread to the whole world and then no one is safe anymore. This is actually where it comes into play to protect against this type of attack.I can no believe what is possible.Good article.

Yes, same as using Wi-Fi / IP cameras for security.. people don't know how such systems are weak/vulnerable !I think that the real problem is there is no real pedagogics on how such systems we using everyday are weaks/dangerous. officials just choose not talking about problems that have no solution, more that this they looks like promoting them in way they can profiting from it !For example for IP cameras, if eveyone with just some very basic hacking knowledge can break them.. it means that promoting them among other more secure systems was deliberate for an intention of having a ready available free global vast surveillance coverage!PS:  and LoyceV because someone once said he's Korean

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: That’s crazy, criminals are getting way too sophisticated. I recently had security posts fitted into the tarmac on my driveway to stop thieves stealing my car. They have a way these days of stealing keyless cars by emitting a signal from some kind of box which pairs with the keyless car fob in your house to open your car & start the engine. There is a lot of this going on where I live now so I took action. I also have a pouch to put my fob in which stops anything pairing with it.
